title: Last one I promise!
content:
I know I have posted a few ID requests in the last couple of weeks and I promise this will be the last for a while!

I got this from the last copy of Interview before M/M (Paris) took over. Does anyone know what face it is?

Many thanks,  
Lach

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [DF\_Type004.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706/http:/typophile.com/files/DF_Type004.jpg) | 215.52 KB |
author: Lachlan Sumner

comments.content:
Probably it is a custom typeface. It’s appeared several times. See [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706/http:/typophile.com/node/50616).  
You might like [Monotype Modern Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=243283) and [Scotch Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/shinntype/scotch_modern_full_family/).

hmm I thought it might have been another Fabien Baron custom, but to be sure.

Thanks for getting back to me so fast.

Cheers,  
Lach

Hi,

Here is a "M" from the [Interview Magazine 2009 editorial calendar](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706/http:/www.interviewmagazine.com/image/advertise_info/Editorial-Calendar-2009.pdf)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BaronMT_4274.jpg)
  
and, according to Acrobat, the font is BaronMTModernText. Not _exactly_ the same, but...

Michel

I had missed the notes at the bottom of the calendar. They call the font BaronMTModernFine-Italic

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140504112706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/notes_5810.jpg)
